{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3638849,"name":"Declan","username":"TCG_2984","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/9d8465/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-05-28T20:54:56.506Z","cooked":"

Hello,

We are using FRC PathPlanner for an upcoming offseason event, and I am experimenting with the app. I’m curious what would happen if the robot wasn’t placed in the exact spot that is defined as the starting spot. If it is close but not exact, could it screw up the rest of the path or would it just auto adjust to the defined starting position before running the path?

Thanks

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-05-28T20:54:56.506Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":10,"reads":137,"readers_count":136,"score":77.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502503,"topic_slug":"path-planner-starting-position","display_username":"Declan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":67648,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/path-planner-starting-position/502503/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3638895,"name":"Jared Van Horn","username":"CuteRedpandas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cuteredpandas/{size}/243322_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-28T21:23:46.763Z","cooked":"

In our experience if it’s at least solidly close to the correct position it operates fine if you have vision that corrects your position, we had a very consistent auto because of it.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-05-28T21:23:46.763Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":127,"readers_count":126,"score":35.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":502503,"topic_slug":"path-planner-starting-position","display_username":"Jared Van Horn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51417,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Alum/NJIT Student"},"post_url":"/t/path-planner-starting-position/502503/2","custom_user_title":"Alum/NJIT Student","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3639302,"name":"Nolan Barker","username":"therekrab","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/therekrab/{size}/248500_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-29T02:36:55.914Z","cooked":"

Yeah, this is correct. The reason this works is because PathPlanner builds an “ideal path” that basically tells the robot where to go throughout the path, based on the current time. Then, a PID controller is used to correct for error between the desired current position and the actual current position, and small errors in the beginning can be remedied quickly without hassle, resulting in the end of the auton positioned correctly.

One important technical edge case does arise, however. Depending on your vision setup and what tags you see during auton, if your robot is rotated in the wrong direction and PathPlanner resets your odometry - and hence gyro offset - and you also happen to use trig-based estimation for vision, you could encounter an issue where your pose is consistently off throughout auton, or at least until you see multiple tags. Read this post to see Mechanical Advantage’s description of the problem - and their solution comes later on in the thread.

If you don’t place near the position or if you dont have the vision correction in your code robot will go crazy and goes nonsense places.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-05-29T12:55:52.700Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":60,"readers_count":59,"score":17.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":502503,"topic_slug":"path-planner-starting-position","display_username":"Mete Karadeniz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51417,"username":"CuteRedpandas","name":"Jared Van Horn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cuteredpandas/{size}/243322_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":68396,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/path-planner-starting-position/502503/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3640469,"name":"","username":"LHACK4142","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lhack4142/{size}/196107_2.png","created_at":"2025-05-30T02:12:32.542Z","cooked":"

If you don’t have vision correction, yes, the robot will go crazy. If you do have vision and the robot is not at the starting position (but reasonably close), you’ll be fine – we have started several feet away from our defined starting position successfully several times.
TLDR @therekrab is correct and you can place the robot not at the starting position
